title: Retail Sales Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 days. I interviewed at University Co-op (Austin, TX) in Jul 2022
Interview Descriptions: Very smooth process. Interviewed on zoom since I wasn’t in Austin. Asked a couple of availability questions and typical interview questions. You were able to ask questions also. I was told to hear back in 1-2 days.
Interview Questions: Availability was mostly discussed during the interview.

title: Sales Associate Interview
Interview Descriptions: Quick and easy, everyone was enjoyable to talk to and I got a lot of information out of the process. Overall super quick and easy and I had no difficulties with the process.
Interview Questions: What questions do you have for me?

title: Sales Associate Interview
Interview Descriptions: it was pretty short but I met with the hiring manager basically gave a short talk about customer service and then we got a tour of the store and storage room and was asked to come in another day for the first shift.

title: Sales Associate/Cashier Interview
Interview Descriptions: I emailed inquiring about an online posting, had a short exchange about what time worked best, went to store the same week to have interview in person, and was called the next day to come in and completed paperwork with HR.
Interview Questions: Asked about experience in customer service, what I knew about UT/campus, where I was from, what I was involved in on campus, my schedule/availability

title: Marketing Orientation Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University Co-op (Austin, TX) in Apr 2018
Interview Descriptions: Had to fill out an initial application to the internship. Once I filled out the application I was contacted by the Marketing Manager and a phone interview was set up. I was remote at the time, so I imagine if I was located in Austin, then the interview would've been in person. But after that interview I was offered the internship.
Interview Questions: What customer service experience do you have?

title: Cashier Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at University Co-op (Austin, TX)
Interview Descriptions: Quick, easy, nothing to worry about. Met with the manager in the store, he asked me a few questions about my work history. Asked what my availability was and said he would call me back. I got a call back within a couple of hours.
Interview Questions: They asked me what I knew about the UT football team.

title: Sales Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University Co-op (Austin, TX) in Aug 2016
Interview Descriptions: Online employment application, received a call asking to come in for secondary interview.  The hiring manager was very approachable and personable.  I got a very good feeling about  the potential work environment had I been offered the position.
Interview Questions: What is my schedule like? How many hours am I looking to work per week on average.

title: Cashier Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at University Co-op
Interview Descriptions: It was very easy. It was in the basement with a random employee, not with HR. 1 on 1 during one of their hiring fairs. Simple questions about past work, work ethics, availability, and why I should be hired. It lasted maybe 20 minutes and that's it.

title: Financial Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University Co-op (Austin, TX) in May 2016
Interview Descriptions: The interviewing process was easy. It was all behavioral. They want to see that you can work well with a team in seasonal situations of high and low volumes. The CEO was my interviewer, but she was very welcoming and wanted to se me succeed. Overall it was a great experience.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work at the Co-op?

title: Retail Sales Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University Co-op
Interview Descriptions: The interview was really just a summary of the job requirements with a really sweet woman. They offer jobs on the spot (or they did) at one point. Seemed like a simple process.

title: Sales Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University Co-op (Tokyo)
Interview Descriptions: I had forth interviews, first and second were group interview to be asked what do you like about this company and why do you apply for this. Third was small group like 3 candidates. Forth was 1-2 candidates.
Interview Questions: Very general interview questions like what do you like about this company, why do you apply for this, what do you want to do in the company etc.

title: Sales Associate/Cashier Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University Co-op (Austin, TX) in Aug 2015
Interview Descriptions: I asked if they were hiring, they hired me on the spot during textbook rush. There's nothing else to say to fill up 30 words. sorry but the management was very nice.

title: Sales Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University Co-op (Austin, TX) in Jul 2013
Interview Descriptions: I called the company asking if there were any open positions, but there weren't any open at the time.  I got a call back from HR a few weeks later saying they were hiring for season (temp) employees.  I set up a time for an interview, and during my interview I submitted my resume and filled out some forms on the spot.  There were no interview questions, and I even went straight to a training shift right after I turned in my forms.
